title: No-deal Brexit odds: Latest predictions on leaving the EU without a deal
text:
The chances of a no-deal Brexit have dropped considerably after a cross-party grouping of MPs succeeded in passing anti-no-deal legislation through the Commons earlier this month.

This has been compounded by the Supreme Court's decision to effectively force parliament to resume, having declared Boris Johnson's decision to prorogue illegal.

The probability of Britain crashing out on a no-deal Brexit had been steadily increasing following the Prime Minister's "do or die" promise to take the UK out of the EU by 31 October and a lack of progress in negotiations with the EU.

However, prior to the now unlawful prorogation of Parliament, opposition MPs and Tory rebels were successful in passing legislation which...
description: The chances of a no-deal Brexit have dropped considerably after a cross-party grouping of MPs succeeded in passing anti-no-deal legislation through the Commons earlier this month.
